page.title: 11Landscape and Buildings
page.content: Building Methods: The houses and farms show some variety in their construction and age, ranging from reputedly fifteenth century to the l960's. There are six timber-framed buildings in various states of preservation. One has been completely dismantled in the last two years and rebuilt with a new thatched roof, but many have had the thatch either replaced by tile or slate, or covered in corrugated iron or asbestos sheeting. Church and Vicarage are built of stone but the majority of inhabited buildings are in brick, usually bare but some colour-washed. Some Victorian houses have brick ground floors with timbered first floor, whilst others which appear to be brick prove to have been built around earlier timbered originals.
